Fields.DialogueText: Hello Houston, how are you feeling? That battle took a lot out of us.
Me more'n others, Cap, I know that, but don't nobody needs to worry ‘bout me.

Fields.MenuText: You were pretty torn up after the battle, and we needed to put a lot of new men on the line very quickly.

Fields.DialogueText: Plus we got the new ladies, Cap, don't forget. Lotta the folk down in my engine room are Filipino girls. Part'a why I got fixed up so quick.
That's good to hear. Have you had any morale problems with the new crew members we added?
A few. The Japanese an' tha Filipinos don't exactly see eye to eye, but they'll get along.
Personally, I ain't really minding ‘em, always did like seeing new faces and it'd be a dang shame if I didn't get a chance ta practice my Tagalog and Japanese once in a while.
That's good to hear, Houston. We know Sabotage is going to stay out there, so we'll need to pull together if we want to keep ourselves and the people of the Pacific safe.
You ain't gotta tell me, I know we got a war ta win. It ain't over til it's over, and we ain't pushovers.
*ALARM*
I'm glad you think so, because that's the alarm. Get ready, we've got work to do.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I'm not just worried about you. I'm worried about all of us.
What do you worry about?

Fields.DialogueText: Running outta cold beer to celebrate after a scrape.
Always got somebody needs mindin'.
Same here. Everybody's in my basket.
I see 'em Cap! Full speed ahead!
@BATTLE
Houston, are you ok? That looks like a lot of smoke coming out.
Ain't nothin' but a scratch, Cap! Besides, my crew'll get it taken care of faster than a shiny car evading the police.
Still though, that was a nasty hit. You need to keep an eye on yourself out there, ok?
Aw Cap! I didn't know ya cared so much. Don't you worry, this gal can take care of herself and everyone else.
I respect your willingness to put the fleet first, but if you start taking too much damage, we'll need to pull you back from the front.
Don't test a Texan, lest you want to end up having to see a dentist for punched out teeth.

Fields.MenuText: That's insubordination, Houston. However well you fight, I am still your Captain.
Alright, alright, threat rescinded. Just take care of yourself, ok? I don't want you sinking.
Oh jeeze, please don't. I don't want to have to explain that to the crew.

Fields.DialogueText: Shove a saguaro, Cap. I can win this war on my own if I gotta.
Fine, but I don't need you worrying over my shoulder all the time.
Glad ta hear you know when you're beaten, Cap. Why don't you head on outta here?
Sheesh.
Are you ok, Houston? You look pretty down. Are you still upset with me?
No, Cap, I'm not. Was thinkin' about the war, and how it's messed up things fer a lotta people.
Don't worry, we'll find a way to defeat the Morganas and put the world back on track.
I ain't talkin' 'bout tha brujah, Cap. The world was a mess afore they showed their ugly mugs, and it was humanity that did it.
Oh, that.
Yeah, that. What happens if we put the world back together an' all these jerks still wanna run around blowing it up?

Fields.MenuText: That's not our job to think about, Houston. I recommend concentrating on the job at hand.
I think we can put a stop to it. With the war over, all the world's navies together will have a lot of clout.
Why do you think I don't get too close to the sailors? I never know which one will be my enemy when this is over.

Fields.DialogueText: To hell with that, Cap. You can stick your head in the sand, but I wanna make sure tha people of tha world are safe.
Heck yeah, Cap! Knew I liked ya fer a reason! We'll make them idiots ashore see reason.
You're a cold one, Cap. I can respect ya fer it, even if I don't like it much.
*ALARM*
Introspection will have to wait, that's the alarm.
Alright, one battle closer to tha end a all this.
@BATTLE
All right, we should be on them in an hour or so. Be prepared for the radios to go out.
Aye aye, Cap. Don't worry, I'm lookin' into it.
@BATTLE
Are you sure you aren't trying to catch shots with your hull? That's not normally the tactic I'd advise.
Get off it, Cap. That smoke's nothin' to worry about. We'll be fine soon.
Well, the Morganas seemed to think it was enough that they didn't have to worry about you any more.
They're as stupid as someone trying to teach a fish to climb a tree. Still, bought me enough time ta line up those shots.
It did at that. They just saw the smoke and came to their own conclusions. Which is the same thing I did, I suppose.
They ain't payin' ya ta be an idiot, Cap. You'll know I'm gone when the oil wells in Beaumont run dry.

Fields.MenuText: I'm always surprised by the size of your ego, Houston. Try not to let it get the best of you.
I'll be sure to keep an eye out, the next time I see you trailing smoke and oil. I appreciate the warning.
Fair enough! I suppose next you'll say you're sending the Morganas to the bottom of the ocean to look for more?

Fields.DialogueText: Everything's bigger in Texas, hon. Do your best ta get over it.
Go sit on a cactus, Cap. Watch me come through tha next battle without a dang scratch on my paint.
Good thing I'm sending tha brujah down... Dammit, Cap, ya ruined it fer me!
Now if you'll excuse me, I'm gonna go and read the new Chronicle that came in.
Hey, Cap! Ya gave me an idea the other day. When you were being a jerk, that is.
Oh? Do tell, Houston, you're always full of good ideas.
That better not be a jab, Cap. Anyways, I ain't done yet, but I think I got a good plan fer gettin' us a way ta beat Sabotage.
I never really figured you for the mysterious type, Houston. What's the matter?
I don't want you goin' off half cocked, so shut it fer a bit an' let me think.
All right, all right, I'll leave it alone for the moment. On another note...

Fields.MenuText: How much do you remember about the time before you became a Belle?
How are the new sailors fitting in? Are the language barriers proving a challenge?
Do you have anything planned to cook up for the crew the next time you get the chance?

Fields.DialogueText: It's hard ta say, Cap. All of it and none of it. Like I was there, but I ain't had a choice ‘til now. And I remember a lot of Texas history, particularly after the city was founded. Clear as mud, I know.
Good! They're all learnin' fast, and I had plenty of my phrasebooks around that we managed to get most a them at least talkin enough ta work tagether.
I ain't one ta plan that in advance, Cap. It's when I get a chance. I cook fer me, but I share with tha crew, and they're lucky I do.
*ALARM*
Interesting note, but I can hear the alarm. We better get ready, they'll be here soon.
I'll tell tha crew ta saddle up fer action, Cap.
@BATTLE
Time to get it going, guys and gals, 'cause we gotta battle ta win!
@BATTLE
Houston, you have got to be kidding me. Did you get hulled again?
No sirree, ain't even scratched Cap.
I can see the smoke, Houston. You can't hide smoke, as it goes up in the air.
I'm telling the truth, Cap. Ain't you got no trust for your friends, huh?
You're running really low in the water. I can see you dipping below your normal waterline.
Are you calling me fat, Cap? Because I'll push your teeth down your throat.

Fields.MenuText: You know what? I'm just going to leave this alone. Whatever you're doing will be your own problem.
Look, as long as you aren't going to put the fleet in danger, I'm not going to push you on this.
Take care of yourself, Houston. That's an order.

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks, Cap! I'll let you know if it works! I got big plans.
I appreciate that, Cap. I ain't never gonna hurt tha fleet. I know what I'm doing, an' I'll make sure you know when I've got it workin'.
Don't you worry about me, Cap. I got all kinds a plans, and I'm willin' ta bet large on this one.
If that'll be all, Cap, I got some work to do below decks.
Houston, are you down here in the engine room? Someone said they saw you head this way.
Over here, Cap! Down past the gantries 'n such.
There you are, I've been looking all over for you. The mess chief sent me down here with a couple of cold ones for you.
Thanks, Cap! Take five, y'all, momma needs a break. What brings you done here though, really?
I have to be honest, I really want to see what you've been working on down here. I got these as a bribe.
Well that was smart a ya. Thanks fer tha beer, now whatt'ya think?
Well, it looks like a couple of big flaps being put in on the wall of the engine room.
Yer a bright one, ain't ya Cap? Whattya think I'm doin' with them?

Fields.MenuText: I don't know. Are you trying to make some wings and fly away?
Are you trying to make some flaps and cool down the rest of the fleet?
Maybe you're trying to make a vent so it's a bit easier to see in here?

Fields.DialogueText: That's a bird-brained idea if I ever heard one, Cap! Who ever heard of a ship with wings?
I ain't nearly that generous. They can stew fer all I care, I got bigger plans than that.
I might be, I might not be, don't you worry about it.
*ALARM*
Alright, well, that's the alarm, so I'll have to guess again later.
@BATTLE
Hey, Houston, are you leaking smoke? I think I can smell it, and it seemed like you had some big piles of hull metal laying around.
You better not've hunted me down just ta ask inane questions, Cap.
No, I want to sate my curiosity. Food tends to last longer and go further onboard here than anywhere else in the fleet, and I wanted to see if you had any tips.
Did ya just ask me ta share my grillin' tips with tha rest a the fleet, Cap? That's trade secrets there.
I guess so, but it is for the good of the fleet, after all. You did want to help the fleet, right?
Maybe, if it's for the fleet. I can share the secrets of smokehouse 'cuein', and honestly I just need ta send a chef ta each boat.

Fields.MenuText: I think a few tips and tricks will suffice, we don't really need to completely change the diet on every ship.
Is each ship going to need a full smokehouse? That seems a bit excessive, given that we're at sea.
I don't think the rest of the crews will be happy about having their chefs replaced like that.

Fields.DialogueText: Cap, ya want my help, yer gonna get it. If ya want ta see positive change, yer gonna need ta trust me on this.
You want meat ta keep, don't ya? Well, it's the way ta do it. Ya can store it outside tha cold room if it's smoked, long as it's clean.
Ain't talkin' replacement, Cap. Jus' need ta have some guys that know what they're doin' teach the other cooks how.
Anyways, I'll get right on it, Cap. Can't do too much more on tha secret project yet.
*ALARM*
Can't do much more at all today, that's the alarm.
@BATTLE
Houston, I've been getting some weird reports from the men after battles.
What'cha talkin' 'bout, Cap? Somethin' wrong I oughta know about?
As you know, Standard Operating Procedure is to turn off our radios when the static starts, to avoid any attempts at electronic warfare.
Someone wasn't following the rules, and they said they heard something in the static. They claimed it was like a voice, but not quite.
So the Brujah finally speaks. We only had ta bash her up a few times before we got her attention.
Well, almost. They said it was like a voice, but it seemed to just be a feeling. The crew said it sounded like anger and betrayal... before it cut off.
Well, ain't that a creepy turn of events. You got any idea what tha brujah wanted?

Fields.MenuText: I'm in the dark as much as you are, Houston. I've never heard of something like this.
Maybe it's incensed about whatever event brought the Morganas to our world? This could be a clue.
It might be upset about how thoroughly we've been beating them back. Maybe something brought them here under false pretenses?

Fields.DialogueText: Then I ain't bothered. Let's just keep smashin' them ta pieces until there ain't nothin' left.
I ain't gonna give a flying potato what brought'em here, unless we need to kick its butt too.
I ain't interested in findin' out right now, an' you got a war ta win, doncha'?
I'm not sure why I thought you'd be interested. Regardless, we're heading towards them again, so I'm going to try to get some more data.
@BATTLE
There you are, Houston, I knew I'd find you if I followed the noise.
What're you calling noise? This is music, you no taste havin'--
Right, music, I'm sorry! That's the harmonica, right? Have you given any thought to performing for the crew?
Yes, and it ain't that kind a instrument. Ya play it fer yourself, an' anyone who hears it gets ta be a part a that.
Isn't that how most instruments and most concerts work? You could do a talent show, and let everyone show off their skills.
Cap, I can hit ya between tha eyes with this from here.
Point taken.

Fields.MenuText: How are plans for whatever your secret idea is going, Houston? I'm eager to see it in action.
Have you found a good way to share your culinary expertise across the fleet?
Are you always this touchy when people ask you questions?

Fields.DialogueText: Well you'll have ta wait just a little bit longer. We need a little more time, and ta gather up the right crew.
Yup, and I already got it started. You oughta see tha results sooner rather than later.
Nope, I don't let people ask me questions in tha first place.
All right, we should be meeting the enemy in an hour or two, so be ready.
I was born ready, Cap.
@BATTLE
Hey, Cap, got a minute? I need ya ta pass something off.
What? Do you mean distribute something? I suppose I can do that.
Thanks, Cap! Take these sheets, and these guys, an make sure they're spread throughout the fleet.
All right, you have to tell me what the heck is going on here.
Smoke signals, Cap! Ain't sure why I didn't think of it before, but it's perfect. Everyone can see it, an only we know what it means.
I think I follow. What about these sailors and the sheets? Are these pictures?
Got it in one, Cap! These boys are all Apache, and they volunteered ta teach the signal boys on the other ships how ta read their cloud lingo.
There ain't enough a them for each ship ta have one, but we can give everyone a crash course at least.

Fields.MenuText: That's genius, Houston! How long until you think we can trust it in battle?
Is this the big secret you've been working on? That's not particularly impressive.
I'm sure this will be helpful. What about your other tasks?

Fields.DialogueText: Hold yer horses, Cap. We need ta drill before we can trust this at all. Walkin' in with tha ability ta speak poorly's worse than not speakin'.
Ya ain't seen it in action yet. Give it a chance before you tell it off.
I fixed our biggest problem, Cap! Hold yer horses, I'll fix all yer little complaints soon enough.
*ALARM*
All right, I can wait, but the Morganas will not. That's the alarm.
@BATTLE
All right, y'all! Let's show these Brujah who'se tha boss!
@BATTLE
Houston, don't try to bluff me. I can see the smoke venting out of your side.
You play poker, Cap? Ya really oughta come by the officer's mess game, it gets pretty heated.
Houston, I'm not being deflected again. Why are you smoking?
Aw heck, Cap, it ain't that bad fer me. I reckon I look pretty flashy with it.
Houston, I will order you to drydock if I have to. I will see to it that you stay there, too.
Oh fine, you ain't no fun, Cap. I flipped tha flaps open. Tha ones I was gonna use ta make tha smoke signals.
I remembered how they acted when they thought I was hurtin' last time, so I figured I could catch'em unawares. Worked, too.

Fields.MenuText: That's smart, Houston. I'm impressed, but tell me next time.
You scared me, Houston. I had no idea. The fleet thought we were sinking.
You should have told me before you used a tactic we hadn't been briefed on.

Fields.DialogueText: Well ya know now, don'tcha, Cap? Ain't nothin' ta worry ‘bout!
Ya'll oughta have a lil' faith in me then. Ain't my fault if ya think these BFs can best me.
Well... yeah, that's a good point. I'll put it in tha big book a tactics fer when the radios're out.
I'll alert the rest of the fleet that you're not about to explode.
Oh, so that's why they're keepin' their distance...
Alright, Cap, what d'ya think? Not a bad spread, huh?
Are you serious? This is crazy! There's so much food, and so many different types! We can't make this the main diet.
Can and should. It's easy enough ta do. Most of this is from right along the shore.
Did you cook all of this yourself?
Do I look like a chef, Cap? I ain't never set foot inside a kitchen. I did smoke the meat, though.
And you think you can get the other ship chefs to adopt this diet? Will we have to start foraging more?
I'm already havin' it pounded inta those lunkheads that they gotta be a bit more flexible in what they consider ta be proper food if they want ta survive this war.
And as fer foragin', we already have ta go ta shore occasionally, but most a this stuff keeps fer weeks. Hell, most nuts keep fer years.

Fields.MenuText: Well, you really came through, Houston. This is exactly what I wanted when I asked for your help.
I'm not sure I'm comfortable with making such sweeping changes to fleet operations just for the sake of a few more meals.
Yeah yeah, that's good. Can I eat it now? It looks delicious.

Fields.DialogueText: Dang right I did, ya don't ask me fer help and expect less than tha best.
Tough, I already started. Had a dozen chefs an two score assistants in here observin' when we whipped this up.
You wait for chow time just like everyone else. I'll kick your butt if one rib goes missin'.
*ALARM*
That's the alarm. I suppose we'll have to wait for the battle to be over before we can eat.
@BATTLE
Alright, hit them where it hurts!
@BATTLE
That smoke trick is really working well, Houston. I have to wonder what the Morganas are thinking when you pull it.
It's, uh, it's a pretty good one, right, Cap? Works like a charm.
I thought you'd be happy I was on board, Houston. What's wrong?
Nothin', Cap, it's just a lil' scratch. No need ta cause a fuss.
What's just a little scratch? Houston, did you get hit out there? That is a lot of smoke.
Why don't ya mind yerself, Cap? I ain't got nothin' wrong with me I can't fix by mornin'.

Fields.MenuText: You need to be more careful out there, Houston. With the smoke trick, we can't tell if you're hurt or just faking.
Why didn't you say something earlier? We can bring in another mechanics crew to help you get fixed up.
You need to find out a way to get that under control, and you need to find a better way to signal genuine distress.

Fields.DialogueText: Hey, I was fine, wasn't I? And it worked, didn't it? Lay off a bit.
It's fine, and our crew's got a handle on it. And tha fire's under control.
Alright Cap, I take yer meanin'. I'll get right ta work on that.
I worry about you, Houston. You're my friend, and you push yourself hard.
I can take it.
Good news, Cap! I think with tha drills, we're almost ready ta put tha smoke signals to tha test!
Good to hear, Houston! I'm looking forwards to being able to rely on actual communications, instead of just making plans.
Hey, my plans've got us this far, haven't they?
You're right, they have. I get worried by the unexpected, and the Morganas will figure out what we're doing soon enough.
True enough. Little setback on the plan by tha way. Nothin' big, though.
Oh, I look forward to hearing this. What's the snag?
As it stands, most of the Apache we got aboard can read signals, but only a couple can make ‘em, which I suppose stands ta reason.
Even that's moot, though. My hull's tha only one rigged up ta make tha signals, so I gotta be tha one callin' tha shots, or someone here at least.

Fields.MenuText: You're officially the flagship, if you're the only one who can make any announcements.
That's a pretty big hitch. That means I need to be here the whole time if I want to command the fleet.
What happens if you get hulled like last time? How will they be able to tell the smoke apart?

Fields.DialogueText: I knew you'd see tha right of it, Cap! Glad ta hear yer on board! Heh, didn't do that on purpose.
Eh, yer here all tha time anyways, Cap. I'm tha one's gotta stand yer company.
Then I guess we all die. Be a good enough commander so that don't happen.
*ALARM*
All right, that's the alarm, we can worry about it later. Battle stations!
@BATTLE
Hey there, Cap, you wanted to see me? There's a big side a water buffalo I'm smokin'.
That can wait, there's something I want you to see. We've been logging the transmissions from Sabotage.
It's just static, ain't it, Cap? Who cares what the Brujah's screamin' about.
A large number of people do, but that's not important right now. We've had people listening on the radio during every battle, and writing down what they heard.
What'd they hear, Cap? Ain't figured you for tha suspenseful type.
Mostly static, but they all report feeling an intense paranoia, almost like a ghost was watching them. They all used the word ghost.
Maybe they oughta stop then? Can't say I like ghosts on the radio.

Fields.MenuText: This isn't about ghosts on the radio. We need to find out what they want.
Be serious, Houston. Something is going on here, and we need to know what powers the Morgana have.
I knew I should have talked to someone else about this. You don't care what the Morgana are trying to tell us.

Fields.DialogueText: If they came ta fight me, they want ta die. Simple as that.
They have tha power ta explode and come back. If ya can figure out how ta take that second part away, call me impressed.
Nope. Already know they're just cryin' cause they're scared a me.
*ALARM*
Alright, there's the alarm. Time to gather some more information.
@BATTLE
So, first, I want to say, you were absolutely right. We cut the amount of food we need almost in half with foraging, and we no longer need to make stops on actual ports.
And?
Between the fruits and vegetables and the smoked meat, it's lasting twice as long.
And?
It was rude of me to come into your cabin without knocking first and receiving permission to enter.
That's about right. Let me get you down from there, those mooring cables are mighty tight.

Fields.MenuText: Thank you. I had almost lost feeling in my feet. I swear to never do it again.
You know, a normal sailor would have been court martialed for this.
You aren't going to tell anyone about this, are you? It might undermine my command.

Fields.DialogueText: Almost? Damn, I must be losing my touch.
An' a normal commander would've been dropped in the drink instead a hogtied an' strung up.
I ain't spreadin' rumor's ‘bout you bein' impolite. Count yer lucky stars this is a late watch.
*ALARM*
Ooof, thanks. And there's the alarm, right on schedule.
Don't think I'll ferget this.
@BATTLE
And you're sure it's ready for use? You spent an awful lot of time getting everyone up to speed.
That's tha point Cap. I know exactly what it can do, and what tha fleet can do. This'll work.
What happens if you start leaking on your own? We have a plan for that right?
Tha smoke looks different. We trained the signal guys ta spot tha difference.
What happens if we sink? That'll throw our whole strategy into disarray.
Then we die. Ya ain't always this jumpy... What's gotten inta ya, Cap?

Fields.MenuText: I'm always nervous before a new strategy is implemented. With communications, so much can go wrong.
Don't worry about it, Houston.
I've been worrying about the messages in Sabotage's static. It's starting to get eerie.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, but it won't, I saw ta that. Just do yer job out there.
I ‘spect I deserve that. Suit yerself, Cap.
Well stop it. The brujah ain't got a single straight nail in the box she calls a brain.
No time for it now anyways, that's the static.
Radio off, Cap! Let's send ‘em to the bottom!
@BATTLE
That worked even better than I expected it to, Houston.
Worked about as well as I intended, Cap.
So you expected them to swarm towards you when the signals started? Because you responded well.
Ain't you been payin' attention? They love picking off stragglers, and they ain't got no idea why I'm smokin', do they?
That is remarkably well planned. You didn't tell me again, though.
Must've slipped my mind, Cap.

Fields.MenuText: Houston, you need to be more forthcoming with your strategies. We're all in this together, after all.
I'm just going to give up on reprimanding you for that, as long as it keeps working.
One more incident like this, Houston, and I don't care how helpful you are. I need people I can trust, not ones who don't trust me.

Fields.DialogueText: I know, Cap, I jus' love surprises. Can ya imagine tha look on tha Brujah's face when we lit ‘em up?
That's tha spirit, Cap! Lemme do my thing, an' help me pick up tha pieces when it's over.
Ya can't get rid a me! I'm too good.
*ALARM*
We'll talk about this later. I can hear the alarm, so keep this strategy working.
Of course, Cap. Ya know what they say, every time's tha charm!
@BATTLE
Houston, come here, I have something you need to read.
This better not be more of that Brujah chit-chat yer so keen on.
Just read it, all right? One of the commanders in Manila sent it to us.
"Despair, your champion is dead. Despair, the traitor is dead. Despair, the ghost is dead. Despair, Houston is dead."
What tha hay? This some kinda joke, Cap? I sure as hell ain't dead, whatever he says.
That's not him, Houston. He recorded it from a signal from somewhere in the Pacific, and that's not the best part.
Oh yeah? Tell me the best part of my death, why don't you, Cap?
This is at least the seventh time they've sent this message. They think they've sunk you, over and over again.
Well if that don't beat all! I do love my surprises.

Fields.MenuText: It looks like that smoke trick had unintended consequences.
I think you might actually be succeeding in getting on the Morgana's nerves. I'm impressed.
I'll be honest, it's nice to see you causing someone else a headache for a change.

Fields.DialogueText: What d'ya mean unintended? I planned this all along. Knew the brujah would fall fer playin' possum.
I'd hate fer now ta be tha point where I started botherin' ‘em after I spent so much time'n effort.
Watch it, I ain't too happy ta split yer lip. That'd be a dark day.
*ALARM*
Hey, there's tha alarm! Maybe I'll die again!
@BATTLE
Well, Cap, I'm waiting with bated breath. What's tha verdict?
I just got the call from Manila. Looks like you died again. They were pretty happy about it too.
I love it! They must be pretty dang surprised when I show up. Must be a hell've a surprise ta see me.
There's more, and I think you'll love it. The people love you.
Well of course they love me. I'm fantastic and beautiful, in every way.
Yeah yeah, here's the kicker. They've started to think you really are a ghost. They're calling you the "Galloping Ghost."
I ain't never been more proud a myself than this exact moment, honest and true.

Fields.MenuText: This is a huge boost for morale. The sailors are starting to say we have a ship who can't die, so we're on even ground.
Don't let all this hero worship go to your head, Houston. We've still got a war to fight.
It sure beats your old nickname.

Fields.DialogueText: Even ground? We ain't ever been on even ground. This makes things that much worse fer tha Brujah.
Yeah yeah, I ain't ‘bout ta ferget what we're here for, just ‘cause I'm officially tha most important member a tha fleet.
Hey now, that was uncalled fer. The Rambler was a fine nickname, and I'm just as happy ta see it go as you are.
*ALARM*
Well alright then, let's see if we can't rack up a few more points for your legend.
@BATTLE
Recruitment has been through the roof since the last battle. Most of the ships have a full, if untrained, crew.
Who doesn't want to be a part a tha fleet flagged by tha "Galloping Ghost"?
Please stop that. It was obnoxious enough as The Rambler, but this is just unnecessary.
Yer just upset that ya ain't got a half decent name ta call yer own, Cap. Give it time.
I'm happy the larders are overflowing, we have all the munitions we need, and the ships are fully crewed.
Yeah yeah, yer boring, I understand.

Fields.MenuText: Houston, this is a stroke of good luck, but it's not going to last, and we need to be prepared for the worst.
Oh shut up, and deal me a seat at the next poker game. I need to wipe that smile off your face somehow.
Fine, but enjoy it while it lasts. Winning is temporary, but always fun.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, but that don't mean we can't enjoy it. I do love me some victories.
Oooh, I'm real scared, Cap! I'd hate ta take all yer money.
Ya trying ta philosophise there Cap? I ‘spose I take yer meanin' though.
*ALARM*
Hey, there's the alarm. Another chance to win big.
Can you at least pretend to be less cocky about this?
@BATTLE
Once again, tha Gallopin' Ghost hits tha trail!
@BATTLE
SSSSCCRSH... Traitor!
Hey the radio's workin' again! Wait, I thought we turned that off.
Ghost! Traitor! Champion! Houston! We will burn those you try to protect!
I can't hear ya over tha sound a yer magazine cookin' off, ya mangy mutt.
Don't taunt the unknowable evil, Houston.
We will burn Manila! We will burn all! SSSSCCRSHhhh...
Huh... I wonder what that was about. That brujah really had a grudge.

Fields.MenuText: I told you not to taunt the ancient evil the likes of which man had never seen.
Do you ever listen during the briefings, or to all that intel about their transmissions?
It looks like we found your biggest admirer. Ready to go give her an autograph?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, were ya serious? I thought that was what they were fer?
What do I care what tha Brujah are gabbin' on about? They're a few eggs short of a dozen. Not really worth my time.
Oh yeah, I'm gonna sign my name with her flamin' wreckage at tha bottom of tha ocean.
Still, we need to take that threat into consideration.
I'll give you the bad news first. Manilla is under heavy shelling. Also, the fleet doing it is the largest one we've seen in the Pacific.
Noted, what else ya got ta say.
It's obviously a trap, and they've spotted us coming. I'd say they were moving into position, but they started in position.
That ain't great, but we can work with it. We know where they are, so we can meet ‘em where we want ta.
The runner we sent to the mess said they were out of that beer you like.
That brujah Sabotage'll pay fer that with her life!
Didn't you drink all of those? I saw you drink the last two at lunch, and haven't seen the Dr. Pepper in a while.
What does that have ta do with anythin', Cap?
Fair enough. You know you don't have to do this, right?
Course I do, Cap. She's callin' me out, and she's shellin' my friends ta do it. This ends here.

Fields.MenuText: We know it's a trap, so let's spring it and make them come to us. It'll be a better fight on our terms.
This is a mistake, Houston. We can't beat them by charging straight in like this.
I'm with you Houston. Just don't get us all killed.

Fields.DialogueText: Nope, springin' it from inside. This is about honor Cap, don't try ta stop me.
I can an' I will. This is about me an' her, one on one. Don't try ta talk me outta it.
You got it, Cap. I'm gonna sail right in there an shove my cannons up her nose.
As soon as I'm engaged, the rest of the fleet moves in and hits ‘em from behind. I don't wanna die out there.
@BATTLE
After all that... I'm pretty sure we're going to sink, Houston.
Nah, we'll run aground long before we sink.
The engine room is on fire, and your fuel is about to go up.
Don't worry Cap, it'll go out when we sink.
There's an unexploded shell in the middle of the bridge.
Good place fer it, so we won't lose track of it later.
The engines shut down. We're dead in the water.
I can feel tha tide comin' in, so we'll be ashore any minute.

Fields.MenuText: We're going to die after winning a battle. This is the most disappointing victory ever.
How can you be so calm about everything? You're barely a ship right now.
All right, I defer to your expertise in being a boat.

Fields.DialogueText: Anybody ever tell ya you worry too much, Cap?
Ya can keep yer insultin' comments ta yerself next time. Yer real rude fer someone who ain't even dead.
See? Ain't it a good idea ta trust me? I know what I'm doing.
Houston, you are absolutely insane, and I have no idea how either of us are still alive. By rights, you should be a burning pile of rubble with a me shaped smear on it.
Odds are fer suckers, and rights can hang. Ya just gotta push through.
I stand by my statement, but there is no one I'd rather have by my side out here. Let's go find another fight.
Another pack of em, starboard side. You got enough for one more, Houston?
You know I do, Cap. I always do.
@BATTLE
